class cardlib.Hand(cards=None)¶

Bases: object

Sets class of hand.

Parameters

cards – Set initial cards for pre-determined hand or create an empty hand.

Returns

Empty Hand class or with initially set cards

add_card(new_card)¶

Adds the “new_card” to the hand.

Parameters

new_card – A playing card

best_poker_hand(cards=None)¶

Calculates the best poker hand of the hand, and the added cards

Parameters

cards – List of playing cards in addition to the hand cards.

Returns

PokerHand-class with best poker hand type and best cards.

drop_cards(index=None)¶

Drops the cards presented by index

Parameters

index – A list (or integer) of indices, with first position given as 0.

Returns

Card(s) given by index

show_hand()¶

Presents the cards in the hand.

sort_cards()¶

Sorts the cards by value

sort_cards_by_suit()¶

Sorts the cards by both value and suit, (Clubs, Diamonds, Hearts and Spades)

class cardlib.NumberedCard(value: int, suit: cardlib.Suit)¶

Bases: cardlib.PlayingCard

class cardlib.PlayingCard¶

Bases: object

Playing cards for the deck.

Ranked as NumberedCard: 2-10, JackCard: 11, QueenCard: 12, KingCard: 13 and AceCard: 14

Suits are given as Suit.Spades, Suit.Hearts, Suit.Diamonds or Suit.Clubs

class cardlib.PokerHand(cards)¶

Bases: object

Calculates the best poker hand of the given cards.

Parameters

cards – List of playing cards

Returns

PokerHand class with the hand type of the best poker hand and the best cards.

Example:

>>> h1 = Hand([NumberedCard(2,Suit.Hearts),    NumberedCard(2,Suit.Spades),    NumberedCard(5,Suit.Spades),    NumberedCard(5,Suit.Hearts),    NumberedCard(10,Suit.Clubs)])

>>> ph1 = PokerHand(h1.cards)

>>> ph1.hand_type
<PokerHand.two_pair: 3>
class cardlib.QueenCard(suit: cardlib.Suit)¶

Bases: cardlib.PlayingCard

class cardlib.StandardDeck¶

Bases: object

Creates a standard deck of 52 playing cards.

Returns

Main class StandardDeck. StandardDeck.cards is a list of 52 playing cards in value order Ace-King and suit-order: Spades, Hearts, Diamonds, Clubs

draw()¶

Draws (removes) the top (last) card from the card-list

Returns

A playing card.

shuffle()¶

Reorders the list of cards into a random order
